intro: Myrmeconauclea surianii, commonly known as the Suriname myrmeconae, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
